text: Is anybody else getting 500 errors from Codecov when uploading from Travis? We've been getting it consistently for internal projects.

elements.text: Is anybody else getting 500 errors from Codecov when uploading from Travis? We've been getting it consistently for internal projects.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

attachments.fallback: [February 10th, 2021 2:37 PM] mose: cool, tests in BinaryBuilder now fail because Codecov doesn't like us anymore :weary:
attachments.text: cool, tests in BinaryBuilder now fail because Codecov doesn't like us anymore :weary:

text: Ah, okay, I thought I had seen that somewhere but couldn't recall where else it had been mentioned.

elements.text: Ah, okay, I thought I had seen that somewhere but couldn't recall where else it had been mentioned.

text: for the time being I disabled upload, I thought ti was just our funky setup on AZP, but perhaps it's larger than that

elements.text: for the time being I disabled upload, I thought ti was just our funky setup on AZP, but perhaps it's larger than that

text: We're getting a 500, which suggests to me that it's not an issue with Coverage.jl or anything like that, just something weird on Codecov's end. Do you know whether anyone has reported it to them?

elements.text: We're getting a 500, which suggests to me that it's not an issue with Coverage.jl or anything like that, just something weird on Codecov's end. Do you know whether anyone has reported it to them?

text: this morning I did a brief search, but found nothing

elements.text: this morning I did a brief search, but found nothing

text: Ah, okay. We pay for Codecov, so I'll look into contacting their support using the "hey we're giving you money for a broken service" angle :wink:

elements.text: Ah, okay. We pay for Codecov, so I'll look into contacting their support using the "hey we're giving you money for a broken service" angle

text: oh wow, that must be seriously broken then :grimacing:

elements.text: oh wow, that must be seriously broken then

text: We have required coverage checks turned on and every build from a PR for a critical project is getting a 500 from Codecov, so that's pretty seriously broken :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text: We have required coverage checks turned on and every build from a PR for a critical project is getting a 500 from Codecov, so that's pretty seriously broken
